alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:01AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, Leslie, southeastern Perry and southern Clay Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 401 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fount, or 9 miles northeast of Barbourville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Salt Gum, Ogle and Scalf around 405 AM EDT. Ice Cliff, Brightshade, Lipps, Erose, Mills, Plank, Botto and Goose Rock around 410 AM EDT. Skidmore, Ashers Fork, Queendale, Gardner, Spring Creek, Creekville, Sandy Fork and Marcum around 415 AM EDT. Roark, Essie, Warbranch and Spruce Pine around 420 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
